intro: Quercus leucotrichophora, commonly known as the silver-leaf oak, is a deciduous tree native to the Himalayas. It is characterized by its silvery-white undersides on its leaves, which give it its common name. The plant belongs to the Fagaceae family and is known for its acorn-producing capabilities. It typically grows in mountainous regions at elevations ranging from 1,500 to 3,500 meters. The tree is valued for its hard wood and plays an important role in the ecosystems of its native habitat.
